p: Cockroaches could harbour and disseminate many food-borne microbial pathogens including bacteria, fungi, viruses, and parasites. These food-borne pathogens vary widely in their biological characteristics, host associations, virulence determinants, and transmissions. This implies that cockroaches could play a very broad role in food-borne infections. Given the association between cockroaches and food-borne pathogens, it is important to consider them in food-borne outbreak investigations, which has not been the case hitherto.
